currentResearch.title: Development of a System for End-to-End Autonomous Driving Research: A Case Study at NITK Campus
currentResearch.subtitle: Stochastic Pedestrian Behavior Modeling for Unstructured Traffic Environments
currentResearch.description: This research focuses on developing and validating a comprehensive autonomous driving system capable of handling unstructured traffic environments using stochastic behavioral modeling approaches, specifically designed for university campus scenarios.

objectives.objective: Develop EGO vehicle platform with comprehensive sensor setup
Create high-fidelity simulation environment of campus region
Design pedestrian crossing intent predictor using stochastic modeling
Incorporate real-time campus behavioral data from EGO vehicle sensors
Test stochastic model in both simulation and real campus environment

publications.title: Stochastic Modeling for Pedestrian Crossing Prediction in Autonomous Vehicles: A Campus Environment Study
publications.targetVenue: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA 2025)
publications.abstract: This paper presents a novel stochastic approach for predicting pedestrian crossing intentions in unstructured campus environments. The proposed method integrates multi-modal sensor data to generate probabilistic trajectory predictions with uncertainty quantification.

publications.title: Autonomous Driving in Unstructured Environments: A Comprehensive System for Campus Navigation
publications.targetVenue: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
publications.abstract: A comprehensive overview of the end-to-end autonomous driving system developed for campus environments, including system architecture, sensor integration, and real-world deployment challenges.

publications.title: Real-time Sensor Fusion for Autonomous Vehicle Perception in Campus Environments
publications.venue: IEEE Workshop on Advanced Robotics and its Social Impacts (ARSO 2024)
publications.abstract: This work presents a sensor fusion framework combining LiDAR, camera, and IMU data for robust perception in dynamic campus environments.

publications.title: M.Tech Thesis: Development of Stochastic Behavioral Models for Autonomous Vehicle Navigation
publications.abstract: Complete documentation of the research work including literature review, methodology, implementation, results, and future work recommendations.

experiments.name: Campus Environment 3D Mapping
experiments.description: Comprehensive 3D point cloud mapping of NITK campus roads and pedestrian areas using LiDAR sensor
experiments.methodology: Drive-based LiDAR scanning with GPS coordinate mapping
keyFindings: High-fidelity digital twin of campus created

experiments.name: Pedestrian Behavior Data Collection
experiments.description: Systematic collection of pedestrian crossing patterns and behavior data in campus environment
experiments.methodology: Multi-sensor data recording during peak campus hours with manual annotation
keyFindings: Weather impact on behavior patterns identified
Group vs individual behavior differences observed

experiments.name: Stochastic Model Training and Validation
experiments.description: Development and training of neural network-based stochastic model for pedestrian crossing prediction
experiments.methodology: Supervised learning with uncertainty quantification using Bayesian neural networks
keyFindings: Velocity and head orientation are strongest predictors
Weather conditions significantly affect crossing patterns

experiments.name: Autoware Integration Testing
experiments.description: Integration of stochastic prediction module with Autoware planning pipeline
experiments.methodology: Real-time integration testing with simulation validation

experiments.name: Real-World Campus Testing
experiments.description: Comprehensive testing of complete autonomous system in controlled campus environment
experiments.methodology: Progressive testing from simple to complex scenarios with safety protocols

datasets.name: NITK Campus Point Cloud Dataset
datasets.description: High-resolution 3D point cloud map of NITK campus

datasets.name: Campus Pedestrian Behavior Dataset
datasets.description: Multi-modal sensor data of pedestrian crossing behaviors

futurePlans.item: Deploy system on public roads with regulatory approval

awards.description: For the paper on real-time sensor fusion
